titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3529) to provide tax incentives for economic recovery and assistance to displaced workers.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-348, by Mr. Reynolds.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3529 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. The yeas and nays shall be considered as ordered on the question of passage. Clause 5(b) of rule XXI shall not apply to the bill or amendments thereto. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 115.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 320.
DEBATE - The House continued with debate on H. Res. 320.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 198 (Roll no. 507).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 12/19/2001--Reported to House without amendment. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.R. 3529 (tax incentives for economic recovery and assistance to displaced workers (economic stimulus)).
